interfaces.kernel

Interface JCL_orb<R extends JCL_result>


  • public interface JCL_orb<R extends JCL_result>
    ORB is the main component of JCL. It locates the object, solving location and name transparencies, and calls a stub to proceed the rpc. Communication Fault tolerance are implemented in orbs.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Joubert Lima

    • Method Detail

      • register

        boolean register(java.lang.String mainComponentClass,
                 java.lang.String nickName)
        Parameters:
        mainComponentClass - The class to be executed remotely.
        nickName - The class name to be used by JCL.
        Returns:
        True if it has successfully registered, false otherwise.

        Returns:

      • register

        boolean register(java.io.File[] jars,
                 java.lang.String classToBeExecuted)
        Parameters:
        jars - - The jar file (first file) and its dependencies (the remaining files) registered.
        classToBeExecuted - - The class name to be used by JCL. No class packages.
        Returns:
        True if it has successfully registered, false otherwise.

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.String className,
                             java.io.File[] jars,
                             java.lang.Object[] defaultVarValue)
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable key.
        className - - The class to be executed to instantiate the global var.
        jars - - Jar list with className class.
        defaultVarValue - - The constructor variable arguments.
        Returns:
        The instance if the variable is created. null otherwise.

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.String nickName,

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.Object instance)
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable key.
        instance - - A user variable value.
        Returns:
        True if the variable is registered. False otherwise.

      • destroyGlobalVar

        boolean destroyGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key)
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable key.
        Returns:
        True if the variable is set null. False otherwise. If the variable is previously locked the destroy will return false. The user must unlock first and destroy after.

      • setValueUnlocking

        boolean setValueUnlocking(java.lang.Object key,
                          java.lang.Object value)
        Updates the variable value. Unlock a variable if it is previously locked.
        Parameters:
        key - - Global variable key.
        value - - Global variable value.
        Returns:
        True if value is correctly updated or false otherwise.

      • getValue

        java.lang.Object getValue(java.lang.Object key)
        Parameters:
        key - - Global variable key.
        Returns:
        The global variable value or an error or null if no variable exists.

      • isLock

        boolean isLock(java.lang.Object key)
        Parameters:
        key - - Global variable ID.
        Returns:
        return true if global variable is lock or false if global variable is unlock. boolean isLock(Object key).

      • getValueLocking

        java.lang.Object getValueLocking(java.lang.Object key)
        Parameters:
        key - - Global variable ID.
        Returns:
        The global variable value or an error or null if no variable exists. The pair getValueLocking and setValueUnlocking implements critical sections in JCL.

      • unRegister

        boolean unRegister(java.lang.String nickName)
        Parameters:
        nickName - The class name to be removed by JCL.
        Returns:
        True if it is removed, false otherwise.

      • containsTask

        boolean containsTask(java.lang.String nickName)
        Verify if there is a task registered in JCL.
        Parameters:
        nickName - The task name.
        Returns:
        True if JCL contains such a task, false otherwise.

      • containsGlobalVar

        boolean containsGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key)
        Verify if there is a global variable registered in JCL.
        Parameters:
        key - - global var ID.
        Returns:
        True if JCL contains such a global variable, false otherwise.
